definition: to differentiate/to draw a distinction/to divide into categories

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
case insensitive/not distinguishing capitals from lowercase letters
pinyin: bu4 qu1 fen1 da4 xiao3 xie3

definition: case sensitive/distinguishing capitals from lowercase letters

sentences.english: Subspecies are often difficult to distinguish from one another.
sentences.chinese: 區分不同的亞種是很困難的。

sentences.english: Those two ideas must be kept distinct from one another.
sentences.chinese: 必須把那兩種思想區分開。

sentences.english: Distinguish between an lvalue and rvalue.
It is possible to make qualitative distinctions of worth.
sentences.chinese: 是能對價值進行定性區分的。

sentences.english: In the spiritual life we have to make a distinction between two kinds of loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 在靈性生活當中，我們必須懂得區分兩種不同的孤獨。

sentences.english: Distinguished the definition of kaolin from that of kaolinite .
sentences.chinese: 從研究的角度對高嶺土和高嶺石的概念進行了區分。

sentences.english: Required services are sometimes called requisitions to help distinguish needs from capabilities.
sentences.chinese: 要求的服務有時被稱作請求，以便同功能需要相區分。

sentences.english: Laws should distinguish materials that are offensive but not demonstrably harmful.
sentences.chinese: 法律應區分令人不快但並不明顯有害的材料。

sentences.english: The problem is, mail servers can't tell the difference between a spurious request and a real request.
sentences.chinese: 問題在於，郵件服務器無法區分僞造請求和真實請求。

sentences.english: A master bedroom is a masterpiece in white with a floating furniture arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 白色調的主臥是一個大空間僅用傢俱區分不同的區域。

sentences.english: Some people are colour- blind: they cannot tell one colour from another.
sentences.chinese: 有些人是色盲，他們不能區分各種顏色。

sentences.english: Young people must be taught to learn the differnces between good and evil.
sentences.chinese: 必須教導青年人學會區分善與惡。

sentences.english: Using relatively density one can distinguish easily between jadeite and nephrite.
sentences.chinese: 利用相對密度可以很容易區分翡翠和軟玉。

sentences.english: The phenomenon of red appear urethral mouth should distinguish between view.
sentences.chinese: 出現尿道口發紅的現象應區分看待。

sentences.english: Each category can be further subdivided, etc. , to use numbers to distinguish between organizations.
sentences.chinese: 每類又可再細分數等，用組織號來區分。

sentences.english: The manifesto marks off the two epochs in the history of the Three People's Principles.
sentences.chinese: 這篇宣言，區分了三民主義的兩個歷史時代。

definition: difference/to distinguish/to discriminate/to make a distinction/CL:個|个[ge4]
aspect/facet/level (political, psychological, spiritual etc)/(geology) bedding plane
